alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 10:51AM PDT until June 05 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and keep river flows elevated. For the Marys River...including Deeth, Test - Charleston, Charleston...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, This is monitoring stage or about 365 cfs. No flooding occurs within the reach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM PDT Friday, June 02 the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to drop below the Action Stage of 5.5 feet Friday, June 02. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday at 12:00 PM PDT.
